steps.title: List the reasons you want to stop eating meat.
steps.content: List the reasons you want to stop eating meat. You might have a vague idea of why you don't want to eat meat anymore or you may have specific reasons. Take a few minutes to write down all the reasons you have for not eating meat. You can refer to this list later if you're struggling and it can remind you why not eating meat is important to you. Examples of reasons could include: [1] X Research source Lowering your cholesterol or reducing inflammation Reducing your environmental impact Improving animal welfare

steps.title: Make small, achievable goals towards giving up meat.
steps.content: Make small, achievable goals towards giving up meat. [2] X Expert Source Tara Coleman Clinical Nutritionist Expert Interview. 22 October 2020. If giving up meat is your ultimate goal, think of all the smaller steps you need to take to get there. Write down goals or barriers that you'll have to get past and celebrate when you achieve them. This can give you momentum for reaching your goal. [3] X Research source For example, you might challenge yourself to give up eating fast food within 1 week or cutting back the number of meals with meat to 3 times a week. Some gradual goals could be cutting out red meat within 2 weeks, not eating chicken within 3 weeks, and not eating pork by 1 month. Make some of your goals fun. You could challenge yourself to try 2 new vegetarian ingredients or cuisine each week, for instance.

steps.title: Set a deadline for when you want your diet to be meat-free.
steps.content: Set a deadline for when you want your diet to be meat-free. As you set your goals, continue to make them more challenging so you can reach your goal of not eating meat. It can help to have a deadline in mind so you know you're working towards a specific end. [4] X Research source You might tell yourself that you want your diet to be meat-free within 3 months. Your goals can gradually work meat out of your diet by then.

steps.title: Create a plan to deal with cravings.
steps.content: Create a plan to deal with cravings. You may find yourself missing meat or at least thinking about it more. Instead of giving in, try to think of an alternative way to satisfy your craving. You might be craving meat because you want a specific flavor, so try these common swaps: [5] X Research source If you're craving a filling, butter flavor, eat avocado instead of meat. Make a peanut butter sandwich instead of chicken if you're craving protein. Eat mushrooms, miso, or parmesan cheese if you're craving a savory umami flavor.

steps.title: Don't give up if you relapse and eat meat.
steps.content: Don't give up if you relapse and eat meat. You don't have to stop eating meat completely. Even eating less meat than you used to can have positive impacts. Giving up meat can be difficult, especially if you've grown up eating it at every meal. Remind yourself that you can work towards your next goal and you'll eventually be able to stop eating meat altogether.

steps.title: Make meal plans for a few days or a week.
steps.content: Make meal plans for a few days or a week. Don't wait until you're really hungry to decide what you want to eat or order. Instead, plan nutritious plant-based meals so you don't have an excuse to just grab a meat-based meal. Set aside a few hours to make a list of the meals you plan to make during the week and the ingredients you'll need. [6] X Research source If you have time, you could also prep some of the ingredients. Chopping produce ahead of time can make it easier to get a vegetarian meal on the table. It's also a good idea to plan some savory snacks since these can curb your cravings for meat. For example, keep smoked nuts, roasted chickpeas, or vegetable chips in the pantry.

steps.title: Use a little meat as a flavor instead of the main dish.
steps.content: Use a little meat as a flavor instead of the main dish. If you eliminate meat from your diet, you might experience cravings. To reduce cravings, try eating meat as a supporting ingredient instead of making it the focus of a meal. For example, buy a package of bacon and cook just a few slices to crumble into pasta with roasted vegetables. [7] X Research source For example, instead of cooking lasagna with ground beef, make a vegetable lasagna but include a few slices of chopped prosciutto to give it a little meaty flavor. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Add new vegetarian ingredients or cuisines to your diet.
steps.content: Add new vegetarian ingredients or cuisines to your diet. It's easy to focus on missing meat, but you can distract yourself and your tastebuds by trying new flavors. For example, instead of eating rice a few times a week, make quinoa or farro. [9] X Research source Swap out your standard meat and potatoes meal for a vegetable and noodle dish, such as veggie udon.

steps.title: Try meat substitutes as you cut meat out of your diet.
steps.content: Try meat substitutes as you cut meat out of your diet. If you really miss the flavor and texture of meat, buy a meat substitute. There are more high-quality meat substitutes than ever, so try a few to see what you like. You can find patties, crumbles or links made from textured vegetable protein, tempeh, or seitan. [10] X Research source Don't forget to check the freezer section of your grocery store for some of these meat substitutes.

steps.title: Add plant-based protein sources to your diet[11] X Expert Source Tara ColemanClinical Nutritionist Expert Interview. 22 October 2020. .
steps.content: Add plant-based protein sources to your diet [11] X Expert Source Tara Coleman Clinical Nutritionist Expert Interview. 22 October 2020. . If you're used to getting most of your protein from meat, you'll need to ensure that you're still getting it in the foods you eat. To get a variety of nutrients, eat different plant-based proteins throughout the day. Try eating: [12] X Expert Source Tara Coleman Clinical Nutritionist Expert Interview. 22 October 2020. Nuts and seeds Beans Lentils Whole grains

steps.title: Talk with your doctor about your nutritional needs.
steps.content: Talk with your doctor about your nutritional needs. It's always a good idea to consult with your doctor about your diet, especially if you're trying to become a vegetarian to improve your health. Your doctor might recommend that you take supplements that contain: [13] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Vitamin B-12 Omega-3 fatty acids Iron Vitamin D

steps.title: Try a flexitarian diet if you want to occasionally eat meat or fish.
steps.content: Try a flexitarian diet if you want to occasionally eat meat or fish. Some people find that they miss eating meat or want to reintroduce it to their diet. Decide if you'd like to start eating meat again in much smaller amounts. If you'd like to eat meat a few times a week, the flexitarian diet might be the best choice for you. [14] X Research source Remember that you're not stuck in any one diet. You might transition from a meat-based diet to a flexitarian diet before cutting out meat altogether.

steps.title: Determine what type of vegetarian diet you want to follow.
steps.content: Determine what type of vegetarian diet you want to follow. Once you no longer eat meat, you need to decide if you'll eat animal products. Some lacto-vegetarians eat dairy, such as milk and cheese, but not eggs while ovo-vegetarians eat eggs but not dairy. Just decide which animal products you'll eat and which ones you'll avoid. [15] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Lacto-ovo-vegetarians don't eat meat, but they do eat dairy and eggs.

steps.title: Eat a pescatarian diet if you want to include fish.
steps.content: Eat a pescatarian diet if you want to include fish. If you live somewhere with easy access to seafood, you might want to keep this protein source in your diet while cutting out red meat, poultry, and pork. Realize that you don't have to eat seafood every day to follow a pescatarian diet. You'll still need to include lots of plant-based protein sources, fruits, and vegetables. [16] X Research source Aim for a variety of seafood throughout the week so you're getting lots of nutrients.

steps.title: Consider a vegan diet if you don't want to eat any animal products.
steps.content: Consider a vegan diet if you don't want to eat any animal products. If you've been a vegetarian for a while and are eating a nutritious diet, you might decide to stop eating all animal products, such as eggs, dairy, and honey. Research which foods to cut from your diet so you can make the switch. [17] X Research source Keep in mind that some food products aren't vegan even though they don't have meat in them. For example, powdered sugar isn't vegan because it's processed with bone char. Some vegans also choose to give up animal products of any kind, including clothing and home goods, such as leather belts or chairs.
